title: Michelle Williams Recited 3 Important Words Before Destiny's Child Reunion. Here's Why
summary: Michelle Williams had a three-word mantra in her head before reuniting with Destiny’s Child last month
story: Michelle Williams had a three-word mantra in her head before reuniting with Destiny’s Child last month.
Beyoncé’s “Cowboy Carter Tour,” which concluded in Las Vegas on July 26, included a surprise Destiny's Child reunion with Williams and Kelly Rowland, as well as performances by Shaboozey and Jay-Z.

Williams reflected on the moment during a July 29 episode of her podcast “Checking In with Michelle Williams,” sharing the behind-the-scenes story about how the reunion came to be, including the last-minute rehearsals and decisions to be made about the performance itself.
During the rehearsals, Williams said she had one past incident from decades prior at the top of mind that kept her on edge.

“I was trying to stay focused because y’all know I still have trauma from falling on ‘106 & Park,’” she said. “I need y’all to be my therapist about that too because every time I perform with the girls, it’s in my head, ‘Do not fall. Do not fall. Do not fall.’”
Williams cited the incident from more than 20 years prior when Destiny’s Child appeared on “106 & Park” to promote their final studio album, “Destiny Fulfilled.”

While performing their song “Soldier” on the show, Williams, Rowland and Beyoncé were walking down the stage in unison when Williams tripped and fell. The singer quickly recovered and stood back up before diving into the dance moves, though the incident left an impression on Williams over the years.
“That’s still in my head,” she added. “Steps do frighten me.”

Williams noted that in the Broadway musical “Death Becomes Her,” she has to descend steps during the show, though she noted that she has “two gorgeous men on the right of me and the left of me holding my hand” to help her down.

“Did I rehearse them steps? Sure did,” Williams said, referring to her “Death Becomes Her” steps. “And then when it came to, I was like ‘Oh my gosh, you dummy. You let fear or lack of trust on that first step,’ because y’all I’m not going to let social media do me, because if that were to happen and I fell, I would not be able to live that down for the next 20 years.”

Williams said the only aspect of the reunion performance she didn't like was her lack of trust in the steps, citing her experience starring in “Death Becomes Her” for over a year between performances in Chicago and on Broadway in New York City.

“There are certain aspects of that stage that I know, I’m comfortable. I don’t have to look at certain marks,” she explained. “ There are certain things that I know that I can hit because I’m at home on that stage. I’m not at home on the ‘Cowboy Carter’ stage, nope. And y’all wasn’t going to do me. So that’s the only thing that I’m like, ‘You could have trusted that the steps were not going to let you down.’”

Williams said that all of the necessary changes were made “wardrobe wise” to make sure she wouldn't tumble on the “Cowboy Carter Tour,” including requesting for the fringe to be cut off of the pants she wore to reduce to risk of tripping and falling.

Despite the fear of the moment she experienced, the singer said that everything fell back into place for the group, sharing, “We turned into little girls again, them teenage girls, those younger girls who just wanted to since, dance and travel the world.”

“And Beyoncé was like ‘Y’all, let’s have fun. We just going to go out there and have fun. Whatever happens, happens, but we’re going to have fun,’” Williams added. “I knew we were going to have fun, we always have fun, but when you come from Destiny’s Child, and then when you see the level of excellence that Beyoncé performs at, you step it up.”
There were no missed steps in sight during the reunion on the “Cowboy Carter Tour.”
The trio, who officially disbanded in 2006, were in lock step as they kicked off their performance with a synchronized strut to kick off “Lose My Breath.”
Their medley transitioned into Beyoncé’s “Renaissance” track “Energy,” including the mute challenge from last tour, before ending with their hit single “Bootylicious.”

title: Comedian Matt Rife Says He's Now 'Legal Guardian' of Annabelle Doll After Buying Occult Museum
summary: Matt Rife says he's taking on a new not-so-funny title: Legal guardian of the allegedly haunted Annabelle doll.
story: Matt Rife says he's taking on a new not-so-funny title: Legal guardian of the allegedly haunted Annabelle doll.
The comedian, 29, said on social media Aug. 1 that he purchased the home of Ed and Lorraine Warren, which has served as an Occult Museum housing the doll.

“If you know me, you know I’m obsessed with the paranormal and all things haunted,” he captioned the post, in part. “You also may know The Conjuring films are my favorite scary movies of all time. So I’m incredibly honored to have taken over one of the most prominent properties in paranormal history.”
He said Ed and Lorraine Warren "arguably put demonology and paranormal into the mainstream and are the very heart of some of the most famous haunted stories of all time."
“We plan to open the house for overnight stays and museum tours so you yourself can experience and learn all the haunted history surrounding this amazing place,” he added.
Rife purchased the property with viral ghost hunter Elton Castee, both of whom are now the legal guardians of the museum's artifacts for “at least five years,” according to Rife.

In a statement to TODAY.com, New England Society for Psychic Research director Tony Spera, son-in-law of the famous paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren, clarified that while Rife and Castee purchased the home, he and wife Judy Spera remain the owners of the artifacts. NESPR is a paranormal research group founded by the Warrens in 1952.
“All of the artifacts, including the infamous Annabelle doll, are owned by Judy and myself,” Spera said, later adding, “We have no plans to ever ‘sell’ the artifacts.”
Spera said they are leasing the artifacts to Rife and Castee in an agreement that lasts five years. He added that Rife and Castee have plans to open the museum “off site" from the Warrens' home.
Castee said on his Instagram story that he will film an "investigation" of the Warren home Aug. 2 at 8 p.m. ET on his YouTube channel.
Days earlier, the two teased on social media that they bought “the world’s most haunted house.”
“We’ve been working on this nearly all year & it is finally happening,” Castee wrote, adding a fire emoji. “I am making sure this will be the best paranormal investigation location on the planet.”
What Is the Annabelle Doll?
The Annabelle doll came into popular culture with the release of a 2014 horror film, which follows the story of a possessed doll haunting a couple nearly to their death.
But the real Annabelle doll was around long before the film — and prior to her first appearance in 2013’s “The Conjuring.”
According to a timeline from NESPR, a nursing student was gifted a Raggedy Ann doll in 1968, which she then shared with her roommate.
The two subsequently “noticed strange occurrences with the doll” in the apartment before a medium told them it was “inhabited by the spirit of a young girl named Annabelle,” the timeline shows.
“The two roommates tried to accept the doll’s spirit and please it only to have it reciprocate maliciousness and violent intent,” the NESPR website says.

Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren deemed the doll “demonically possessed” and removed it from the house, per NESPR, which is funded by the Warrens' son-in-law Tony Spera. The couple then “encased it in a glass box to contain the evil spirited entity.”
A representative from the NESPR did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Rife's post about purchasing Ed and Lorraine Warren's home.
What's Next for the Annabelle Doll?
The Annabelle doll notably left the Warren house this year for the “Devils on the Run Tour.” The nationwide tour showed the Warrens’ work and displayed Annabelle.

During the tour, Dan Rivera, a paranormal investigator and handler for the Annabelle doll, died at 54 on July 13 in a Pennsylvania hotel. Adams County Chief Deputy Coroner Scott Pennewill noted “nothing suspicious” surrounded Rivera’s death.

Pennewill confirmed the Annabelle doll was not present at the scene, adding that Rivera was found alone. Rivera’s cause of death has not been released, and at time, Pennewill said Rivera’s autopsy results would likely be available within 60 to 90 days.
The Annabelle doll is scheduled to appear at the Maine Paranormal & Horror Convention in Augusta on Sept. 6 and 7, per NESPR's website.

After buying the Warrens’ home, Rife and Castee, the doll’s new “legal guardians,” said they plan to host “overnight stays and museum tours so you yourself can experience and learn all the haunted history surrounding this amazing place.”
In a livestream announcing their purchase, Castee walked through the museum for his social media followers and said he wants people to visit to capture any paranormal events to aid in research.

title: Machine Gun Kelly Reveals the Reason He Declined an Opportunity to Audition for 'Sinners'
summary: Machine Gun Kelly opened up about his acting career and revealed why he turned down an opportunity to audition for Ryan Coogler's hit movie "Sinners."
story: Machine Gun Kelly says he was "supposed to be" in Ryan Coogler's hit horror film "Sinners."
While appearing on “The Pat McAfee Show” on July 31, the "Bad Things" rapper revealed he given a chance to audition for a role in the film.
“Like ‘Sinners,’ I was supposed to be in that,” he said before sharing which role he was supposed to audition for and why he didn't feel comfortable portraying that specific character.

“They had me set up to do the audition. It’s the vampire, the one that’s in the house, so he’s the second vampire, the one that the guy comes and he eats the family," he said, seemingly referring to the character of Bert (Peter Dreimanis), a Klan member who is turned into a vampire by Remmick (Jack O’Connell).
Kelly continued, explaining why the role wasn't a good fit. "In the audition, he has to say the ‘n-word’ and I wouldn’t do it."
TODAY.com reached out to Warner Bros. and a rep for Coogler for comment but did hear back.
Earlier in the interview, Kelly talked about his career ambitions and his hope to star in more movies.
“I have a lot of aspirations to be in movies, it just hasn’t panned out that way. I’m on universal timing though so we'll see," he said.

When asked what "universal timing" means, Kelly explained that he's waiting on "angels" to put "something in the works" for him. The rapper later joked that he hopes those opportunities come sooner than later while he's still looks ''young."
"I would really like to be recruited into a movie while I still got some looks," he quipped.
"Sinners," starring Michael B. Jordan, Miles Caton and Saul Williams, tells the story of a pair of twin brothers who encounter a great evil when they move back to their hometown in Mississippi.
The horror film, which was released in April, ruled the box office opening weekend and earned $48 million domestically and $63 million globally, per Variety.

Though Kelly turned down a chance to audition for "Sinners," he has appeared in other Hollywood movies, such as 2019's "Captive State" and "The Dirt," where he played famous Mötley Crüe drummer Tommy Lee.

title: The ’SVU’ OGs Are Back! See New Pics of Mariska Hargitay, Chris Meloni and Dann Florek
summary: Original "Law & Order: SVU" cast members Mariska Hargitay, Chris Meloni and Dann Florek are together again. Meloni shared a series of photos of the three Aug. 2.
story: Chris Meloni has once again broken the internet by gifting "Law & Order: SVU" fans new photos with not one but two OG cast members.
The actor shared three new photos Aug. 2 to his Instagram page with two of his Day 1 co-stars: Mariska Hargitay, who plays Olivia Benson, and Dann Florek, who formerly starred as Capt. Donald Cragen.

"Hangin with friends on a Friday nite @therealmariskahargitay @dannflorek," he captioned a trio of precious pics. In one photo, he holds onto Hargitay as she nestles into his shoulder. The second selfie shows the trio together smiling at the camera, and the third snap shows Meloni with his arm around a beaming Florek.

Meloni revealed he would see his longtime friend Hargitay on Friday in response to a fan's question on X this week. He also had a hilarious reply when another fan wrote, “For f--- sake, kiss her already!”
“I’m f------ trying,” he wrote back.

Florek portrayed Cragen on "SVU" since the show's series premiere in 1999 until his retirement in Season 15. Meloni and Hargitay played two of his detectives, Elliot Stabler and Benson, and now, Hargitay's character is captain of the Special Victims Unit.

"I think Cragen was a father figure to a lot of the people in the show, but for some wonderful reason, I think Dann Florek was kind of a father figure to a lot of the people and the actors," Florek told TODAY.com in January 2024 on the red carpet celebrating the 25th season of "SVU."
Florek's character actually first appeared on the original "Law & Order," which premiered in 1990, before "SVU."
"I always made a point to go out of my way and welcome everyone when they came in, because I remember when people did it for me," he added.

Meloni left the series after Season 12 but reprised Stabler on his own "L&O" spinoff, "Organized Crime," in April 2021. Florek has shared scenes with both Hargitay and Meloni since his "SVU" exit, but never at the same time.

Meloni and Hargitay have appeared on each other's shows multiple times over the past four years. Florek recently guest starred on "OC" and shared some sweet scenes with Meloni. He last made an appearance on "SVU" via a FaceTime call in the show's 500th episode back in Season 23.

It wasn't clear from Meloni's Instagram post if they were on the set of "SVU," which recently started filming its 27th season, but they did appear to be in their "Law & Order" characters' attire. Another OG cast member, however, was seen on set this week filming.

Former “SVU” star Dean Winters, who was also part of the show’s Season 1 cast, was spotted on set July 31. His character, Brian Cassidy, had a fling with Benson in the first season and returned as a more permanent love interest for her after Stabler left. Benson and Cassidy eventually ended things for good, with Cassidy later saying, “You’ve got to admit to me that you were never going to bare your soul to me.”
Benson’s more recent potential love interest has been Stabler.
The two nearly kissed in her kitchen back in Season 24, but they stopped at the last second, with their faces inches apart.
“Elliot, I want to — I want to, but I can’t,” Benson said, adding she feared the repercussions if a romantic relationship didn’t work between them.
“And what if things work out?” he said.
“Elliot, I’m not ready for this,” she responded. “I’m not ready for this.”
Since that scene aired, both actors have respectively spoken out about it, revealing what fans saw on TV that night wasn’t how the scene was supposed to play out.

“To be honest with you, Chris and I thought it should go one way and the powers that be didn’t, so it got changed at the last minute, that near kiss,” Hargitay said in a May 2024 interview with Variety. “Obviously, Dick (Wolf, the show’s creator) gets final say. It’s his show and he didn’t want that.”
Meloni addressed the near kiss in a panel discussion with TVLine and fans in April.
“We were attempting something. I don’t think it worked. But I’m not going to tell you why it didn’t work, because you all have your opinion; I know what transpired,” he said.
Meloni also said he has “no idea” what will ultimately happen with the characters and that those creative decisions are above him and Hargitay.
He did, however, have some creative control over “Law & Order: Organized Crime” in Season 5 when he wrote an episode Hargitay guest starred in.

“I intentionally wrote this because when she and I are together, I inevitably rewrite it, and not out of — you know, just simply because I don’t think there’s anyone alive that knows the relationship as intimately and as well as I do. Or she does,” he told TODAY.com in April.
Meloni also said the humor he infused into some of Benson and Stabler’s scenes, including one in which Stabler jokes to Benson she can watch him get naked, was “a nod to the fans.”

title: Sprinter Sha’Carri Richardson Arrested for Incident Involving Boyfriend at Airport
summary: Reigning 100-meter world champion Sha’Carri Richardson was arrested for allegedly assaulting her boyfriend at the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.
story: Reigning 100-meter world champion Sha’Carri Richardson was arrested last weekend for allegedly assaulting her boyfriend at the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.

Richardson was arrested Sunday on a fourth degree domestic violence offense, according to the police report obtained by The Associated Press. On Thursday, she ran in the opening round the women’s 100 meters at U.S. track and field championships in Eugene, Oregon. She has an automatic bye to the world championships in September in Tokyo as the defending champion.
The 25-year-old Richardson was booked into the South Correctional Entity (SCORE) in Des Moines, Washington, at 6:54 p.m. last Sunday and released Monday at 1:13 p.m.
“USATF is aware of the reports and is not commenting on this matter,” USA Track and Field said in a statement.
Richardson’s agent did not immediately reply to an email request for comment.
The police report said an officer at the airport was notified by a Transportation Security Administration supervisor of a disturbance between Richardson and her boyfriend, sprinter Christian Coleman.

The officer reviewed camera footage and observed Richardson reach out with her left arm and grab Coleman’s backpack and yank it away. Richardson then appeared to get in Coleman’s way with Coleman trying to step around her. Coleman was shoved into a wall.
The report later said that Richardson appeared to throw an item at Coleman, which the TSA indicated may have been headphones.
In the police report, the officer said: “I was told Coleman did not want to participate any further in the investigation and declined to be a victim.”
Richardson won the 100 at the 2023 world championships in Budapest and finished with the silver at the Paris Games last summer. She also helped the 4x100 relay to an Olympic gold.
She had a positive positive marijuana test at the 2021 U.S. Olympic trials and didn’t compete at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: Stevie Nicks Postpones Tour Dates Due to Injury: What She Shared
summary: Rock and roll legend Stevie Nicks says a shoulder injury will impact her ongoing 2025 tour dates.
story: Rock and roll legend Stevie Nicks says a shoulder injury will impact her ongoing 2025 tour dates. This means that fans who purchased tickets for her August and September dates will have their plans postponed.

On Aug. 1, the 77-year-old singer's team addressed fans in an Instagram post wherein they explained that a fracture sustained to her shoulder would require time to heal, prompting the rescheduling of shows previously slated for the coming months.

"Due to a recent injury resulting in a fractured shoulder that will require recovery time, Stevie Nicks’ scheduled concerts in August and September will be rescheduled," the post explains. "Please note that October dates will be unaffected.

The Fleetwood Mac singer's post did not go into details on how the injury was sustained, but assured fans the tour would resume and previously purchased tickets would "be honored on the new dates" and that more information would be provided at the point of purchase.
"Ticket holders are advised to hold on to their tickets and consult the list of rescheduled dates," the message reads.
Nicks is slated to return from her recovery and back for her tour starting Oct. 1 in Portland, Oregon. A string of unaffected October performances across the country will follow.
Fans who purchased affected tickets won't have to worry; their tickets will still be good for the ones announced.
Read on for more details.
What Happens If Your Concert Gets Canceled?
The rescheduled Stevie Nicks shows will now take place between late October and mid-December.
